content.raw: Looks like it's probably not trivial to make it go away only sometimes, and it's pretty useful being able to increase the size of the remote-values-changed display and error messages when you have them, so getting rid of it always is not great. So I'd say we get comfortable with grey pixels for the time being.
content.html: Looks like it's probably not trivial to make it go away only sometimes, and it's pretty useful being able to increase the size of the remote-values-changed display and error messages when you have them, so getting rid of it always is not great. So I'd say we get comfortable with grey pixels for the time being.
